definition: to annoy/to irritate/to be annoyed/to sulk
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Do you have angry fights over homework or how much TV children can watch?
sentences.chinese: 你是否会因作业和看电视的多少和孩子怄气呢？

sentences.english: The scene of this production Ouqi called cavitation bubble.
sentences.chinese: 把这种产怄气泡的景象称为汽蚀。

sentences.english: To this discovery succeeded some others equally mortifying.
sentences.chinese: 之后，他又在她身上发现了几个同样叫人怄气的地方。

sentences.english: You will Ouqi animals with it?
She was so angry that she threw the toy on the ground, breaking it into pieces.
sentences.chinese: 她极其怄气，把玩具扔在地上，把它摔成了碎片。

sentences.english: She's frequently difficult [at odds] with me.
Stay in a hotel rather than in a family home trapped with the difficult person.
sentences.chinese: 与其在家中与其怄气，不如搬到宾馆去住。

sentences.english: She would quarrel with her brother over food when she was young.
sentences.chinese: 她小时候老是和她哥哥为争东西吃怄气。

sentences.english: There's no point wasting energy and getting angry about it.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要因此消耗精力去和那些报道怄气。

definition: to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with
to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
variant of 慪氣|怄气[ou4 qi4]
to be at loggerheads/to have a falling out
to quarrel/to have a row/quarrel/CL:頓|顿[dun4]
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to annoy/to irritate/to be annoyed/to sulk
erhua variant of 較勁|较劲[jiao4 jin4]
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
to be in a bad mood
